title: Barasat Anusilani
detailsOfAchievement: The professional theatre Barasat Anusalini (B.A.) is in its 32 years existence and continuous to work with singular commitment to theatre. A non-profit registered organization, (B.A) is a theatre ensemble of professional and mature artist working through repertory performances and professional training, led by Mr. Rama Prasad Banik & Amal Kumar Dey. B.A. seeks to explore interdisciplinary art forms and diverse artists and audience communities from all over the country. B.A. conducts state wise theater workshop that involve maximum representation of participants from all backgrounds. The workshops are open to students, corporate, artists and academics. Apart from organizing state festival in future may extends to national and all so international theatre festivals, if permits. B.A. started theatre at home i.e. West Bengal organize since inception i.e. 1978, whereby theatre was taken into peoples dressing room, terraces, backyards and other alternative spaces . B.A. organizes various seminars & intends to conferences on theatre related issues.

detailsOfAchievement: Human Resource Barasat Sampark is recruiting in the staffs who have micro finance or microcredit background particularly in West Bengal context. As the organization has crossed the initial stage its head office level staffs and Area Managers have past experience in working with established MFIs in West Bengal. Recruitments are done basically with the people of MFI background with qualification of min H.S. for P.O. to above for all other positions, right now by reference of known people of MFI, but in future through newspaper advertisement. MIS Decision making, Administrative, outreach, portfolio and financial data is generated regularly and control system used it regularly. The micro credit MIS formats are more or less standardized and covers information like no of out reach, security and loan disbursed, weekly realizable and realized etc. Now Sampark has computerized MIS. Education Every one knows that education is the backbone of the nation. Lack of education no development and upliftment of the society is possible. Recognizing the importance of providing education services to the masses , SAMPARK has taken several concrete stapes in the direction . One such step is that SAMPARK has formed child guardian committees which strives for self sustenance for educational system .Remedial classes for outgoing children are another significant measure undertaken by SAMPARK . About 51 children in the age group of 5 to12 years of age including majority of female children were admitted in formal school . SAMPARK provided books for poor intelligent students . Health and Sanitation Health is another major of concern where SAMPARK has maximized its efforts . SAMPARK health program is completely community driven and ensures diversification in health , sanitation and nutrition The core activities in this sector by SAMPARK are Identification of potential village health guides and providing them training and exposure . Propagating and sanitation and cleanliness habits . Construction of toilets and bathrooms . Subsidized distribution of safe drinking water . Maintenance and beautification of tubewell . Organizing regular health camp . Orientation on awareness building training on personal hygiene and Sanitation and nutrition no 326 Free medical checkup no 126 CAPACITY BUILDING Over the past few years, Sampark has learnt that capacity building of the staff is one of the key components of its development strategy . Hence, training has been considered as an important strategy to enhance the proficiency and expertise of the staff. It never compromises on the capacity building of its staff. Micro Credit Programme Micro credit has been universally recognized as one of the most powerful tools to emancipate people from the shackles of destitution and hunger. Poor women create self-employment with loans taken from Sampark making them selfreliant. Sampark norm of lending out loans has been made extremely poor friendly so that it can bring more and more people under its purview. The credit deliverance is made through the methodology of joint liability group model.

detailsOfAchievement: 1. We are working with the vulnerable adolesent girls to develop the awareness among them regarding unsafe migration and missing. We help for rescue, rehabilitation and reintegration of the trafficked girls in their family and the community. In 8 blocks of north 24 parganas. We also work in Seven brick kilns of Barasat - II block under North 24 Parganas for main streaming the children of the brick kilns workers form 0 to 10 years for main straming them in the formal education. We also work with the children of 11 to 18 years for developing functional literacy among them for reading, writting and airthmatic knowledge so they can use this education in their professional works. 2. We work with the women and develop their self help group and provide their loan through our Micro Credit Programme for their livelihood development. 3. We are working with German Leprocy and Tuberculosis Relief Association for providing DOTs to eradicate Tuberculosis from our socities. We organised Health camps on preventing health and eye camps for helping the poor eye patients for getting eye operation through govt programmes. 4. We work on environment awareness among the community regarding Global warming and climate change. In connection with this programme we help to participating afforestration programme in our working areas with the help of the govt. afforestration programme.

title: BARJORA ASHAR ALO
detailsOfAchievement: Barjora Ashar Alo is a non governmental and non profit making organization which was established in 1998. It is grant in aided by ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. It provides special education, physio therapy, speech therapy, sports, games, vocational training, cultural activities etc. It is our pride to say that a student of ours Rama Nandi has passed her board examinations from Rabindra Bharati University. We are also to say that two students f ours namely Arup Mishra and Tanima Pal are special employee of our school under Deen Dayal Disabled Rehabilitation Scheme under Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. The chalks that are made in our school are successfully sold in the local schools. Other activities of us include making of boutique, rakhi, badges, candles which are being sold at the local market which again the source of stipend for our students. Some students of our school namely Tia Bangal, Aparna Mal, Rama Nandi are performing at per with the general students. We conduct our own Annual Programme, Sports, Excursion. Else then that we are constructing our school building. Since the grant of Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment is very irregular which is creating obstacles in the path of success. We strongly believe that regular grant will enshrine the path of success.

detailsOfAchievement: Barrackpore Sahayogi Social Welfare Society was formed in the year 1995 with an aim to help the economically and socially under previledged masses. We started with organising awareness camps on eradication of social evils and educatng people for their well being. We also planted hundreds of trees by the side of B.T.Road as well as the river side road.Subsiquently we have been organised skill development training programmes on handicraft items, food processing, medicinal plants, computer hardware & software, IT , mass communication etc. We have been empanelled by NIESBUD under the Skill Development Ministry as a training partner. Besides we also work on consumer affairs, women labours, unemployed youths, SHGs, farmers and school children. Every year we also organised health related camps.

title: BARUIPARA NRITYALOK
detailsOfAchievement: Nityalok, a socio cultural institution dedicated to dance, which founded in 15thDEC 1999,by SUTAPA AWON PRADHAN, to preserved, promote and propagate, Indian rich cultural traditions and heritage. The institution runs on the tradition of the Guru Sishya Parampara of ancient India, where the Guru or teacher the Shisya or student share special bond. Nrityalok main focus areas is the teaching of bharatnatyam Dance.It is also imparts training in Rabindra Nritya, Creative dances, Folk Dances and Joga. Through this various dance style Nrityalok has composed different type of dance drama likeMOHUA SUNDARI, SAJU RUPAI KATHAKATHA, MAGHBALIKA, TASER DESH, MUKTI,ARDHANARISWAR and ORA KAJ KARA. The Productions has been made in collaboration with Department of culture, Govt of INDIA, Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre, State music academy and has been performed in various Dance Drama festivals . Besides this production making and tanning Nrityalok also concentrate on lecture demonstration for cultural awareness. Teachers and experts has given lecture demonstration at I.I.C DELHI, Dhaka University Bangladesh, Mahatma Gandhi Institute Mauritius South Africa and also organized lecture demonstration at Kolkata and other state of West Bengal. Within last ten years has participated major dance festival like Uday Sankar Dance Festival, Sangeet natak academy dance festival, Pragati Maidan Trade Fair, Rajya hayaiya utsab, Balijatra festival, Sankardev Kalakhatra Assam, Incredible India Singapore,Duars utsab, Tea garden utsab,Prativa utsab , Nritya natya festival etc. Last five years nrityalok is also arranging a summer camp and theatre workshop in kolkata and Midnapur for children. Young students of Nrityalok have participated in Dance Festivals organized by the Zonal cultural centers, West Bengal dance group federation, where their performances have been highly appreciated.

detailsOfAchievement: A.Legal Awareness Programme organised with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women. Legal Awareness Programme was organised in Murshidabad District in West Bengal with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women in 2014-15. NCW provided a financial assistance of Rs. 200000. Organised at Venue: Talgram on 14th and 15th February 2015. The objective of the Legal Awareness Programme (LAP) was to empower women and girls with the knowledge of the laws related to women, legal rights and duties, to enable them, to share power equally, gain full access to the means of development, and to inspire a whole generation of women to work together towards achieving equality and justice. B. Food Packet Distribution to Widows with Donation from Orphans in Need. Food Packets were distributed to widows with donation from Orphans in Need. In the year 2014-15, Orphans in Need provided a donation of Rs. 210000 to Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. C. Mid Day Meal Expenditure. Mid Day Meal is provided at Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. Education facility is provided to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. An expenditure of Rs. 119300 was made on Mid Day Meal in 2014-15. D. Find Out Disabled Children Program Every year, we organise Disabled Children Programme. Through Community Survey, every year our organization finds 25 disabled children. We provide Education facility to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. Student assessments are implemented throughout the year to evaluate continued enrolment in this program.

detailsOfAchievement: This is a computer as well as soft skill training Institute. Nevertheless it has several motto. We mainly train computer hardware, software, Spoken English, Nursing training, Personality Development and so on. Apart from this we have a school for kids. We take special care for backward students. In this complicated and competitive society young generation getting hesitated and jobless due to lack of their skills on above mentioned matter. Therefore to make the young generation skillful we trying our level best to have many projects. Meanwhile we are going to have women skill Development programme such as tailoring, Hand craft, Embroidery and so on. Every year we arrange huge skill development programme, Seminars, Awareness camp. We also held many competitions on Drawing, Quiz Contest, Dance, Drama, Music, Recitation, Hand craft among the rural people. Our objective is not only to make the backwards but also all aged and categories people enriched, skillful and efficient. Not only that we also have several future plans. We want to serve on Medical awareness camp and programme on blood donation, AIDS, free eye test and so on. We also taking care of old aged persons. In this society they have no place, Young generation is about to forget the contribution of them. We personally are treating their problems, sufferings, troubles. Recently we conducted garbage cleaning operation with the help of young guys. Above all our service is the total development of the rural people in every corner of the interior. We want to offer a golden independent society on the palm of the government of India.
